newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's Alston wants formal SBS response.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's Alston wants formal SBS response.

text.p: Australian Communications Minister Richard Alston said on Monday he expected a detailed from the Special Broadcasting Service (SBS) on allegations that it had breached its ethnically-aimed charter.
"They (the allegations) need to be treated seriously and I therefore expect a detailed response," Alston told reporters in Sydney.
SBS has been accused of moving away from its brief as a multi-cultural broadcaster to chase trendy middle-class viewers.
Channel Nine's Sunday television programme renewed that allegation and aired others on Sunday.
Although he was generally pleased with the broadcaster's performance, Alston said the allegations were substantial and needed further discussion.
"There can always be problems at the margin, but I think in general terms it (SBS) is continuing to provide a multicultural alternative," Alston said.
"It does cater for all Australians and I think they've been taking their responsibilities pretty seriously," he said.
"But this is the first occasion on which there's been any substantial complaints or criticism and obviously we'll be wanting to discuss them further."
Alston said he had asked for a formal response from SBS chairman Nicholas Shehadie.
